metadata.title: CVE-2024-41055 on Ubuntu 14.04 LTS (trusty) - medium
metadata.description:
In the Linux kernel, the following vulnerability has been resolved:mm: prevent derefencing NULL ptr in pfn_section_valid()Commit 5ec8e8ea8b77 ("mm/sparsemem: fix race in accessingmemory_section->usage") changed pfn_section_valid() to add a READ_ONCE()call around "ms->usage" to fix a race with section_deactivate() wherems->usage can be cleared.  The READ_ONCE() call, by itself, is not enoughto prevent NULL pointer dereference.  We need to check its value beforedereferencing it.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2024-41055` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-3.11.0-12-generic - 3.11.0-12.19
linux-image-3.11.0-12-generic-lpae - 3.11.0-12.19

No subscription required
